result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Proceedings: 
Motion Hearing
Date: 10/26/2016
Reporter: Melanie Nelson.

Attorney Yolanda M Springfield Woodard in court on behalf of defendant.  Mauricio Cardona appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is located in Dodge County Jail, not present.  Atty. Woodards speaks to court concerning motion to withdraw plea.  Court speaks and states that she has read the transcript, and the Court warned defendant twice of immigration on case 14cf1702.  Atty. Woodard argues.  Court speaks to counsel on 971.04, client to be present.  Court is stating she has no authority to hold this hearing without the defendant.  Court is stating that a proper record needs to be made, and that a proper motion to be made, defendant to be here, with proper transcripts to be ordered and supplied.

  Def waived reading of Information.  Def by Counsel enters a plea of NG.  Motions due w/i 20 days; bail continued.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.

Trial judge -  Br 2

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Robert B. Hurley.  Mauricio Cardona appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
